trans-unit.source: Create Indexer
trans-unit.target: Create Indexer

trans-unit.source: Create Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Create Indexer (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can create a new indexer within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST request.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new indexer within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST request.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the data source name on the URI.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the data source name on the URI.

trans-unit.source: If the data source does not exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the data source does not exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of indexers allowed varies by pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of indexers allowed varies by pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: The free service allows up to 3 indexers.
trans-unit.target: The free service allows up to 3 indexers.

trans-unit.source: Standard service allows 50 indexers.
trans-unit.target: Standard service allows 50 indexers.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="a8b1e21e-7703-4718-8e29-c8825354b3ec" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Limits and constraints (Azure Search)</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-version</languageKeyword> is required.

trans-unit.source: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The current version is <codeInline>2015-02-28</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The body of the request contains an indexer definition, which specifies the data source and the target index for indexing, as well as optional indexing schedule and parameters.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request contains an indexer definition, which specifies the data source and the target index for indexing, as well as optional indexing schedule and parameters.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.

trans-unit.source: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.
trans-unit.target: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Indexer schedule
trans-unit.target: Indexer schedule

trans-unit.source: An indexer can optionally specify a schedule.
trans-unit.target: An indexer can optionally specify a schedule.

trans-unit.source: If a schedule is present, the indexer will run periodically as per schedule.
trans-unit.target: If a schedule is present, the indexer will run periodically as per schedule.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler is built-in; you cannot use an external scheduler.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler is built-in; you cannot use an external scheduler.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Schedule</languageKeyword> has the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Schedule</languageKeyword> has the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>interval</languageKeyword>: Required.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>interval</languageKeyword>: Required.

trans-unit.source: A duration value that specifies an interval or period for indexer runs.
trans-unit.target: A duration value that specifies an interval or period for indexer runs.

trans-unit.source: The smallest allowed interval is 5 minutes; the longest is one day.
trans-unit.target: The smallest allowed interval is 5 minutes; the longest is one day.

trans-unit.source: It must be formatted as an XSD "dayTimeDuration" value (a restricted subset of an <externalLink><linkText>ISO 8601 duration</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#dayTimeDuration</linkUri></externalLink> value).
trans-unit.target: It must be formatted as an XSD "dayTimeDuration" value (a restricted subset of an <externalLink><linkText>ISO 8601 duration</linkText><linkUri>http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema11-2/#dayTimeDuration</linkUri></externalLink> value).

trans-unit.source: The pattern for this is: <codeInline>"P[nD][T[nH][nM]]".</codeInline> Examples: <codeInline>PT15M</codeInline> for every 15 minutes, <codeInline>PT2H</codeInline> for every 2 hours.
trans-unit.target: The pattern for this is: <codeInline>"P[nD][T[nH][nM]]".</codeInline> Examples: <codeInline>PT15M</codeInline> for every 15 minutes, <codeInline>PT2H</codeInline> for every 2 hours.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>startTime</languageKeyword>: Required.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>startTime</languageKeyword>: Required.

trans-unit.source: A UTC datetime when the indexer should start running.
trans-unit.target: A UTC datetime when the indexer should start running.

trans-unit.source: Indexer parameters
trans-unit.target: Indexer parameters

trans-unit.source: An indexer can optionally specify several parameters that affect its behavior.
trans-unit.target: An indexer can optionally specify several parameters that affect its behavior.

trans-unit.source: All of the parameters are optional.
trans-unit.target: All of the parameters are optional.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>maxFailedItems</languageKeyword>: The number of items that can fail to be indexed before an indexer run is considered a failure.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>maxFailedItems</languageKeyword>: The number of items that can fail to be indexed before an indexer run is considered a failure.

trans-unit.source: Default is `1`.
trans-unit.target: Default is `1`.

trans-unit.source: Information about failed items is returned by the <link xlink:href="630813ce-f125-47dc-967a-6d434b37b2ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Information about failed items is returned by the <link xlink:href="630813ce-f125-47dc-967a-6d434b37b2ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Indexer Status (Azure Search Service REST API)</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>maxFailedItemsPerBatch</languageKeyword>: The number of items that can fail to be indexed in each batch before an indexer run is considered a failure.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>maxFailedItemsPerBatch</languageKeyword>: The number of items that can fail to be indexed in each batch before an indexer run is considered a failure.

trans-unit.source: Default is `1`.
trans-unit.target: Default is `1`.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>base64EncodeKeys</languageKeyword>: Specifies whether or not document keys will be base-64 encoded.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>base64EncodeKeys</languageKeyword>: Specifies whether or not document keys will be base-64 encoded.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search imposes restrictions on characters that can be present in a document key.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search imposes restrictions on characters that can be present in a document key.

trans-unit.source: However, the values in your source data may contain characters that are invalid.
trans-unit.target: However, the values in your source data may contain characters that are invalid.

trans-unit.source: If it is necessary to index such values as document keys, this flag can be set to true.
trans-unit.target: If it is necessary to index such values as document keys, this flag can be set to true.

trans-unit.source: Default is <codeInline>false</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Default is <codeInline>false</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Request body examples
trans-unit.target: Request body examples

trans-unit.source: The following example creates an indexer that copies data from the table referenced by the <codeInline>ordersds</codeInline> data source to the <codeInline>orders</codeInline> index on a schedule that starts on Jan 1, 2015 UTC and runs hourly.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates an indexer that copies data from the table referenced by the <codeInline>ordersds</codeInline> data source to the <codeInline>orders</codeInline> index on a schedule that starts on Jan 1, 2015 UTC and runs hourly.

trans-unit.source: Each indexer invocation will be successful if no more than 5 items fail to be indexed in each batch, and no more than 10 items fail to be indexed in total.
trans-unit.target: Each indexer invocation will be successful if no more than 5 items fail to be indexed in each batch, and no more than 10 items fail to be indexed in total.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: 201 Created for a successful request.
trans-unit.target: 201 Created for a successful request.
